summary: Barcode validation fixed - TEST-001 now accepted as valid barcode

problem_resolved.issue: Valid barcode 'TEST-001' was being rejected with validation error
problem_resolved.error_message: Invalid barcode format. Barcode must be 1-20 alphanumeric characters, ending with a number, and may contain hyphens.
problem_resolved.root_cause: EC2 instance had outdated version of manga_lookup.py with different validation logic
problem_resolved.solution: Copied updated manga_lookup.py file to EC2 instance

requirements: May contain alphanumeric characters and hyphens
test_cases: TEST-001: Valid (8 chars, ends with number, contains hyphen)
T000001: Valid (7 chars, ends with number)
MANGA005: Valid (8 chars, ends with number)
TEST001: Valid (7 chars, ends with number, no hyphen)

barcode_validation: Should proceed to next step without error
Test other valid formats: T000001, MANGA005, TEST001
expected_behavior: Invalid barcodes should show appropriate error messages
Workflow should proceed to barcode confirmation step

immediate: Test barcode validation with 'TEST-001' and other formats
Verify workflow proceeds correctly through all steps
monitoring: Check for any other validation issues
Monitor user feedback on barcode input
